title: "If you have any questions, feel free to join us on Discord
body: where we will tell you you're wrong and then close the room."

replies.body: Opening a discussion, whether with board moderators, a supervisor, your parents, a friend, or anyone else, does not mean that people will agree with you or capitulate - because it doesn't necessarily mean you were right and they were wrong.

> [{quoted}](name=GatekeeperTDS,realm=NA,application-id=6heBIhQc,discussion-id=T1V1Tf1V,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2019-05-05T03:39:04.368+0000)
>
> Opening a discussion, whether with board moderators, a supervisor, your parents, a friend, or anyone else, does not mean that people will agree with you or capitulate - because it doesn't necessarily mean you were right and they were wrong.

I wish someone would tell Boards mods that. If they were able to entertain the idea that they might be wrong, something might actually come of the occasional "how can we make Boards better?" threads. But that's okay; it's a lost cause. :)

> [{quoted}](name=KFCeytron,realm=NA,application-id=6heBIhQc,discussion-id=T1V1Tf1V,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2019-05-05T03:49:55.524+0000)
>
> I wish someone would tell Boards mods that. If they were able to entertain the idea that they might be wrong, something might actually come of the occasional "how can we make Boards better?" threads. But that's okay; it's a lost cause. :)

I have frequently acknowledged removals or actions I feel were incorrectly taken and overturned them. The fact that you may not *personally* have had us adjust our actions with regards to *your* concerns does not mean we never do it or that we refuse to consider that we might be incorrect.

> [{quoted}](name=The Djinn,realm=NA,application-id=6heBIhQc,discussion-id=T1V1Tf1V,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2019-05-05T14:01:35.722+0000)
>
> I have frequently acknowledged removals or actions I feel were incorrectly taken and overturned them. The fact that you may not *personally* have had us adjust our actions with regards to *your* concerns does not mean we never do it or that we refuse to consider that we might be incorrect.

Next time you ask for Boards feedback because somehow nothing changed the last time you did so, think of this thread.

I've went to the discord twice I think. Once I was pretty much attacked from the 3rd message or so when I wasn't even disputing the action taken. The second time was relatively fine. There are both good mods and bad mods, you can't just lump them all in together.
